column1: SPATIAL CONFLICT RISK REGISTER — Renovation Plan
Renovation conflicts are more complex than new builds — existing protected elements + live structural work create unique spatial risks

column7: Hoarding wall between demo zone and East protected elements. Daily check
If hazmat found: full stop-work in affected area. Quarantine zone established immediately
Prop positions limit access. Mark clearly. No loads placed near props during beam removal
Crane must NOT swing over East zone. Lift path: North → West → dining only. Banksman required
Two heavy beam deliveries same week. Sequence: Parallam Mon, Timberstrand Thu. Separate crane setups
Both heavy – West staging only. Sequence: joists first (lifted to level), then block staged below
Scaffold gaps designated for window pass-through. Windows delivered before scaffold fully erected
Concrete pump positioned North-East. Chute reaches East porch. Fire-escape stair barriered – no concrete contact
12"×12" post on existing fdn. Scaffold for post must not block fire-escape path at any time
Gas-proof ceiling must be complete before electrician works in garage. Sequenced: ceiling → inspection → electrical
Electrical penetrations through fire-rated ceiling require fire-stopping. Specify before rough-in begins
Type X must be used in rated zones. GC to mark all sheets before delivery. Inspector to verify before taping
Specified assembly only. Any substitution voids fire rating. Inspector to verify assembly before topping
Paint completely removed from interior before panel energised. No exceptions – fire risk
Coordinate both inspections same week. GC to pre-submit all documentation 1 week prior
